pageContext.claim: “You know, Michigan was the last stop that I made. Right? I made it in Grand Rapids, Michigan! It was 1:00 in the morning. Crooked Hillary had come in with Barack Hussein Obama. And they came in together with Bill Clinton actually and all of them. And it was unscheduled, meaning they found out they had a problem, right? It was unscheduled. They were not s-- And they got here at 7:00. They had 500 people. I got here at 1:00 in the morning, started speaking at 1:00 in the morning in Grand Rapids. We had 32,000 people.”
pageContext.analysis: This is a fantasy. The Michigan venue where Trump rallied in the early morning hours of Election Day 2016, DeVos Place in downtown Grand Rapids, has a capacity of 4,200, far less than the 32,000 claimed by Trump. (Perhaps that many were waiting outside, for a total of 8,000, local media estimated.) Hillary Clinton held a rally the same day at nearby Grand Valley State University; it was described as a “capacity crowd” at a venue that holds 4,100 people.
